title: Firefox opens links in the tab that's currently open instead of opening new ones
content: For a few days, I've been having a problem with links opening in the tab I'm currently using instead of new ones. It was random, I don't recall changing anything. I'm using Windows 10.
creator: pl.riseone.pl

title: Location trouble on Windows 10 and Firefox 92.0
content:
Using latest updated Windows 10 and latest updated Firefox 92.0, when I open up Google Maps and click on "Show your Location" button it shunts me off to the middle of Chicago, rather than downtown Menlo Park, CA.

I double checked whether my WIndows Settings were set to allow location, and it was still set to "On." I also tried using Chrome and there, everything worked as expected. I also tried Microsoft Edge, and there it was broken as well.

So, the problem could be with Windows or Firefox apparently...Not sure how to fix or at least work around the problem.
creator: dirk_kiehne

title: I can't get rid of my history.
content: I'm using Waterfox. I can't get rid of my history. I thought I erased it, but it's still there!
creator: familylinkhakuso

title: Simplest way to extract text content regularly from HTML?
content: When I call wget on a webpage, I get raw HTML in response. I would like to write a simple parsing script which extracts the main article text content from web pages with similar structure, i.e. different documentation articles about Microsoft Visual Basic for Applications. I am pretty sure I should inspect the HTML tree, figure out which nodes tend to contain article headers and paragraphs, and then just write a script that retrieves those nodes. What would be the simplest way to inspect the HTML tree to find the nodes, and then with which library should I extract the text content from those nodes? Thank you
creator: juliushamilton100

title: Search
content:
Re thread https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1334131

The solution works, great, however this should be the default, it allows zooming, it is more balanced, etc.

There is at least two other threads that complained in or around this same issue, reset this to deatult next update or sooner!!

Cheers

Phil B
creator: philbowyer007

title: macOS finder window not displayed when downloading a file
content:
Hi, I've got an issue when I ask to download and save a file from a website. The macOS finder window is well openened, but partially mixed with the current web page. it not put on the top. Most often, I must open another app, like Safari and come back to Firefox in order to put it on the top and to be able to change the file name, select de folder and at the end save the file. Attached sample.

It is the same when I ask from Firefox menu to Save As a web page.


Thank you for your feedback.

title: web pages are different

title: Maximum number of bookmarks when syncing?
content:
Is there a maximum number of bookmarks that can be synchronised? In the past (I don't know exactly when) there was a limit of about 5000 bookmarks. I have the impression that this limit has now been dropped and all bookmarks are synchronised. Is that right?

Greetings from Austria, Gerhard

title: scroll bar disappears
content: FF92.0, Big Sur. I really just noticed that the scroll bar on the right hand side disappears rather quickly (in just a second or two). Is there some way to make it hang around? Really pretty annoying having to make it show up by manually scrolling with a mouse wheel.
creator: danflester

title: Error code SSL_ERROR_RX_MALFORMED_ALERT when connecting to Facebook only.
content:
Since late last night, I've been having issues connecting to Facebook when using Firefox. Through my own troubleshooting efforts, I've run multiple Virus and Malware scans via AVG, Malware Bytes, TDSS Killer and Microsoft Safety Scanner, to no avail. What doesn't help is that when checking Facebook in Chrome, the error code I get is NET::ERR_SSL_OBSOLETE_VERSION relating to TLS 1.0 and 1.1. Are there other things I should try on my end as to the cause of this issue?

To my knowledge, the issue is only with Facebook. Other websites I frequent are connecting with no issues.
creator: blaster5426

title: Comments not accepted in Youtube "Comment failed to post" since upping to 92
content: Cannot post any comments successfully on Youtube. Disabled adblock, etc. Get the error "Comment failed to post." This happened occasionally with earlier Firefox browser, but I assumed it was youtube auto-deleting my post for some keyword infraction.
creator: spiritgumm1
